2.text: Doth thy thought seem right to thee, that thou shouldst say : I am more just than God?

3.text: For thou saidst : That which is right doth not please thee : or what will it profit thee if I sin?

4.text: Therefore I will answer thy words, and thy friends with thee.

5.text: Look up to heaven and see, and behold the sky, that it is higher than thee.

6.text: If thou sin, what shalt thou hurt him? and if thy iniquities be multiplied, what shalt thou do against him?

7.text: And if thou do justly, what shalt thou give him, or what shall he receive of thy hand?

8.text: Thy wickedness may hurt a man that is like thee : and thy justice may help the son of man.

9.text: By reason of the multitude of oppressions they shall cry out : and shall wail for the violence of the arm of tyrants.

10.text: And he hath not said : Where is God, who made me, who hath given songs in the night?

11.text: Who teacheth us more than the beasts of the earth, and instructeth us more than the fowls of the air.

12.text: There shall they cry, and he will not hear, because of the pride of evil men.

13.text: God therefore will not hear in vain, and the Almighty will look into the causes of every one.

14.text: Yea when thou shalt say : He considereth not : be judged before him, and expect him.

15.text: For he doth not now bring on his fury, neither doth he revenge wickedness exceedingly.

16.text: Therefore Job openeth his mouth in vain, and multiplieth words without knowledge.
